at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf

Interface DataPointObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataPointObserverImplementation

    public interface DataPointObserver
    All classes implementing this interface can be registered at data points. After registration, state and value changes of the data points buffers will be signalled by method calls to the registered observer instance.
    See Also:
    DataPoint.addDataPointObserver(DataPointObserver), DataPoint.removeDataPointObserver(DataPointObserver)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void bufferAssigned(DataPoint dataPoint, java.lang.String bufferName)
      A buffer has been assigned to the data point.

    • Method Detail

      • dataPointStateChanged

        void dataPointStateChanged(DataPoint dataPoint,
                           BufferState oldOne,
                           BufferState newOne)
        The overall state of the data point has changed.
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - the affected data point
        oldOne - the state left
        newOne - the current state of the data point

      • bufferAssigned

        void bufferAssigned(DataPoint dataPoint,
                    java.lang.String bufferName)
        A buffer has been assigned to the data point.
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - the data point
        bufferName - the name of the assigned buffer

      • bufferDetached

        void bufferDetached(DataPoint dataPoint,
                    java.lang.String bufferName)
        A buffer has been detached from the data point.
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - the data point
        bufferName - the name of the detached buffer

      • bufferChanged

        void bufferChanged(DataPoint dataPoint,
                   SimpleData oldOne,
                   SimpleData newOne)
        A buffer has changed its state or value.
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - the data point
        oldOne - the outdated buffer data. This argument may be null, if the buffer just has been assigned.
        newOne - the current buffer dataThis argument may be null, if the buffer just has been detached.
